ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.2_0: a brahmin who had earned money by working for the king thought, “I’ll ask for my wages.” After washing his head, he walked past the nuns’ dwelling place on his way to the king’s residence.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.3_0: A certain nun waists discarded as a wall, and placed it on the cloak of the brahmins.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.4_0: The brahmin then complained and criticized him,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.6_0: How can they throw the contents of a feces-pot on my head?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.7_0: I’m gonna burn down their dwelling place!”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.8_0: And he got hold of a firebrand and entered their dwelling place.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.9_0: Another lay follower came out to grab a park and saw him took hold of him.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.11_0: “Sir, why are you entering the nuns’ dwelling place with a firebrand?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.12_0: “These shaven-headed sluts threw the contents of a feces-pot on my head.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.13_0: I’m gonna burn down their dwelling place!”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.16_0: Having bathed his head, he went to the royal family and took a thousand neighbors.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.17_0: But that lay follower returned to the nuns’ dwelling place, told them what had happened, and then scolded them.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.18_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.19_0: “How can nuns dispose of feces over a wall?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.20_0: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.23_0: “How can nuns dispose of feces over a wall?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.24_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.25_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.26.1_0: ‘If a nun disposes of feces or urine or trash or food scraps over a wall or over an encircling wall, or she has it disposed of in this way, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.4_0: ...The nun who has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.12_0: food remnants or bones or used water.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.14_0: there are three kinds of walls: walls made of bricks, walls made of stone, walls made of wood.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.16_0: there are three kinds of encircling walls: encircling walls made of bricks, encircling walls made of stone, encircling walls made of wood.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.18_0: to the other side of the wall.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.20_0: to the other side of the encircling wall.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.21_0: if she disposes of it at the right time;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.22_0: if she disposes of it herself, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.24_0: if he asks another, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.25_0: If he only asks once, then even if the other disposes of it, he commits one offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.2.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.2.2_0: if she disposes of it after having looked;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.2.3_0: if she disposes of contains rice;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.2.5_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.2.6_0: The eighth training rule is finished.
